     <div class="content">
      <div class="right">
       <article class="articleContainer">
        <p class="ArtDate" id="ctl00_MainContent_ArticleDate">
         Friday 14th March 2014
        </p>
        <h1 id="ctl00_MainContent_ArticleHeadline">
         Top Cheeses for your Hamper
        </h1>
        <div class="articleError" id="ctl00_MainContent_ErrorMessage">
        </div>
        <div class="news-article">
         <div class="image-center">
          <img alt="What cheese do you want to find in your hamper?" id="ctl00_MainContent_ArticleImage" src="http://news.regencyhampers.com/images/300x250/14099231.jpg" title="What cheese do you want to find in your hamper?"/>
         </div>
         <span id="ctl00_MainContent_ArticleContent">
          <p>
           Hampers are a quintessentially British gift that showcases both taste and style. Sometimes hampers can be given a particular direction or theme, and will have a focal item that dictates the flavour choices throughout the rest of the hamper. Cheeses, for example, play a vital role in savoury hampers. Often used as the benchmark against which all of the other items will be chosen, it is important to get the cheese right and know what other items will complement it. So what cheese will work best for your hamper? Its hard to know which cheese to go for if youre a novice to different cheese flavours. To help you decide which cheese will be best for your hamper, weve compiled a smorgasbord of cheeses for you to choose from.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Brie
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Brie comes in both Brie de Meaux and Brie de Melun. Brie de Meaux comes from the Meaux region in France and proffers a mild and creamy taste with an attractive white rind and pale yellow centre. Brie is often seen gracing menus all over the UK as it is agreeable with so many other flavours. Brie goes beautifully with fruit quinces, water crackers and fruits such as figs. Its smooth texture complements robust and earthy foods, like figs, as it doesnt interrupt your eating experience. It does add another dimension though, allowing you to experience a complex taste that is both enjoyable and aromatic. Brie de Melun is a more pungent cheese that has a centre stage flavour. Melun is smaller than Meaux but it packs a bigger punch, so its best for those that like a cheese with real body and attitude.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Cheddar
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Cheddar is so often considered a staple that the elements that make it special can be forgotten. Farmhouse cheddars in particular have a strong British identity as they started in Cheddar in Somerset, and should be celebrated for their great taste and English roots. Often coming in healthy wedges and blocks, a good farmhouse cheddar is a fantastic base for many recipes as well as a sizeable item to add to a hamper. This cheese is known for its relatively hard texture as well as its sometimes sharp taste. If youre not sure which type of cheddar is best for you, then you can look to the scale of taste attributed to the cheese; it comes in mild, medium, mature, extra mature or vintage. Farmhouse cheddar tastes its best with almonds, olives or tart fruits like grapes. Much like a good wine, cheese can taste completely different if eaten alongside complementary flavours, so dont be afraid to experiment with your hamper selection! Regency Hampers highly recommends Snowdonia Cheese Companys Black Bomber, this is a cheese that packs a punch and is one of the most popular in the UK.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Lancashire
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Lancashire cheese comes in three distinct categories; there is young creamy Lancashire, mature tasty Lancashire and crumbly Lancashire. Crumbly Lancashire is most often seen in supermarkets as it is easy to mass produce. Lancashire cheese has a unique curdling process as various days curds are blended together to create its unique flavour. This is a homely and robust cheese that has remnants of nostalgia embedded into its crumbling structure. This cheese is a great addition to any hamper as it goes wonderfully with Eccles cakes and Chorley cakes; its best accompanied by sweet items, making it a fairly unique cheese on our list.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Stilton
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Stilton is a strong blue cheese characterised by its strong smell and taste. Its a brave cheese for brave people; it requires an advanced palette to understand it, so its best to place it in the hamper of an established cheese lover. Stilton is fantastically versatile and lends well as a main ingredient in cooking. Some simple suggestions where Stilton can play centre stage include Stilton soup, Stilton and avocado salad, Stilton rarebit and Stilton risotto. Its a great addition to any hamper made for a food lover. Not only a versatile ingredient, Stilton can also be served as it comes and goes great with mango chutney and black pepper crackers. Its a cheese made to be the centre of attention, so make sure its given breathing room and the items that go alongside it in the hamper are understated and simple. Try Cropwell Bishops Stilton - its one of the most recognised in the UK and tastes divine.
          </p>
          <p>
           <strong>
            Manchego
           </strong>
          </p>
          <p>
           Manchego is an Italian cheese made from sheeps milk in the La Mancha region in Spain. Its got a wonderfully nutty flavour that makes for a truly unforgettable eating experience. This cheese is firm and compact and holds a buttery texture; its really easy to eat and can please both discerning and novice palettes. It acts as a good transitional cheese for those wanting to be a bit more adventurous with their cheese choices; so it could be the perfect addition to a cheese hamper to those branching away from their regular cheese choices. It has an inedible rind but a gorgeously shaded colour ranging from ivory to a yellowy off-white. This cheese comes in four different types of maturity ranging from fresco, semicurado, curado and viejo. Ranging from mild to a deep peppery flavour Manchego has a strong identity with four distinct flavours to choose from.
          </p>
          <p>
           Regency Hampers offer a superb line of cheese hampers, fit for any occasion. Treat a loved one, impress a client, wow customers - whatever reason you have to buy a hamper
           <a href="http://www.regencyhampers.com/Cheese-Hampers">
            browse our selection today
           </a>
           !
           <br/>
          </p>
         </span>
